titles.title: Continuing Appropriation (eleventh)
Making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 1996, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Appropriations.

Mr. Livingston asked unanimous consent that the Committee on Appropriations be discharged from further consideration of H.J. Res. 163 when called up; and that it be in order at any time to consider the joint resolution in the House; that the joint resolution be debatable for not to exceed one hour, to be equally divided and controllled by Mr. Livingston and Mr. Obey; that all points of order against the joint resolution and against its consideration be waived; and that the previous question be considered as ordered on the joint resolution to final passage without intervening motion, except one motion to recommit, with or without instructions. Agreed to without objection.
Consideration initiated by a previous order of the House.
Considered by a previous order of the House.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the unanimous consent agreement of Wednesday, March 13, 1996, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the joint resolution.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to a previous order of the House.

vote.text: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 238 - 179 (Roll no. 62).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/13/1996--Introduced. Amends the Balanced Budget Downpayment Act, I (Public Law 104-99) and Public Law 104-92 to extend March 15 appropriations deadline provisions to March 22.
